titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Brian Carpenter

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-09-13T21:17-0400

did.physdesc: 4 sound tape reels (5 hr., 17 min.) : analog, 7 1/2 ips, half track, mono ; 7 in.
did.abstract: Field recordings made in Arizona in 1965. Hopi songs of a wide variety, including kachinas, clown, and corn-grinding songs, many with translation and commentary. Also includes Pan-Indian English-language "pachala" songs and discussions of different types of songs, dances, ceremonies, and subsistence activities.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Manuscript material accompanying these recordings can be found in the Phillips Fund Collection (Mss.497.3.Am4).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Robert Black in 1966 (Acc. 1966-898r). This material was recorded with the assistance of a Phillips Fund grant.
